metadata.name: In Lonesome Universe
metadata.description:
Mom and dad,

You left without saying a word. Growing up, it was very hard for me to face the reality that both of you are happy without me. When I was in school, I remember having these gold medals in my hands yet I came home with a frown. When I was in the peak of my teenage years, I remember having these bouquets of flowers yet I still felt unloved. Both of you created a void that nobody could ever fulfill because you - you are irreplaceable. And when I had my first lover, when he left, it was okay because you know what I said?

My dad broke my heart before you did.


But mom, dad, thank you for leaving because I learned to be strong, to be mature way beyond my age, I learned to stand up for myself.

I had to. 


So now, hereâ€™s your little flower, blooming, growing and shining without you. 

Thank you for inspiring me. 

Inspiring me to be nothing like you.
